meanings.definition: A way in which a set or number of things can be ordered or arranged.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned about permutations when discussing different ways to arrange numbers.
meanings.sent2: The permutations of the colored blocks on the shelf created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The permutations of toppings on the pizza made it look like a colorful work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe offered endless permutations of outfits, each more stylish than the last.
meanings.sent5: The permutations of flowers in the garden made it a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the order or arrangement of a set or number of things.
meanings.sent1: The permutations of furniture in the room gave it a fresh new look.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the permutations of her playlist, always mixing up the songs.
meanings.sent3: The permutations of ingredients in the recipe resulted in a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The permutations of characters in the story kept the readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The permutations of colors in the painting added depth and interest to the artwork.
